hybridMode.speaker: Pixel
hybridMode.text: Perfect! You know games but PyGame is new territory. That's actually a great combo!
hybridMode.followUp: So how do you usually like to learn new tools?

options.text: Just let me dive in and figure it out!

unlockEditor.speaker: Pixel
unlockEditor.text: üéâ Boom! You've got full access to the WYSIWYG Editor now! This is where things get really fun!
unlockEditor.followUp: It's basically like having creative mode in Minecraft - drag, drop, tweak, and watch your game come to life!
unlockEditor.additionalText: Quick rundown: drag stuff from the left, drop it on your canvas, tweak settings on the right. The Python code writes itself while you build. Pretty neat, right?

options.text: Wait, show me the ropes first?

editorTutorial.speaker: Pixel
editorTutorial.text: Smart move! Let me give you the quick tour - it'll save you time, trust me!
editorTutorial.followUp: Think of it like this: left side is your toy box, middle is your playground, right side is where you tweak stuff.
editorTutorial.additionalText: Pro tip: Start with a character sprite, then add some platforms. Everything you drop becomes instant Python code. It's honestly kind of mesmerizing to watch!

gamePath.speaker: Pixel
gamePath.text: Alright, time for the fun part! What kind of game is bouncing around in your head right now?

options.text: Something with swords and magic and epic quests!
Ooh, dark dungeons and treasure hunting
SPEED! I want to go fast!
A story-driven adventure would be cool

workStyle.speaker: Pixel
workStyle.text: Nice choice! Now, quick question - how hands-on do you want to be?

options.text: Just give me the tools and let me build!
Hold my hand a bit, I want to learn as we go

gameType.platformer: Jumping games! Love it! First thing - we need a hero who can bounce around. I've got some awesome robot sprites that would be perfect!
gameType.rpg: Ooh, an RPG! You know what's cool? Starting with your hero's look and feel. Want to design your character first?
gameType.dungeon: Dark and mysterious, I like your style! Let's set the mood - thinking torches, stone walls, maybe some skeletons?
gameType.racing: VROOM VROOM! Okay, first big decision - are we talking cars, spaceships, or something totally wild?
gameType.puzzle: Puzzles are my jam! Are you thinking match-3 style, or more like sliding blocks? We should start there!
gameType.adventure: Story time! Every great adventure needs an opening that hooks players. Want to craft that first moment?
gameType.default: Interesting! Let's start simple and build up from there. How about we get your main character sorted first?

learnPath.speaker: Pixel
learnPath.text: Smart choice! Python's like the secret language of games - once you know it, you can make anything!
learnPath.followUp: I've got 10 super fun lessons lined up. We'll start simple and before you know it, you'll be making actual games!

options.text: Let's start from the very beginning!
What will I learn? Show me everything!
Actually, I might know some of this already...

suggestLesson3.speaker: Pixel
suggestLesson3.text: Sweet! You've got the basics down. How about we jump into making your code think?
suggestLesson3.followUp: Lesson 3 is all about decisions - like 'if the player hits a wall, bounce them back!' Super important for games!

suggestLesson5.speaker: Pixel
suggestLesson5.text: Oh nice! You're past the beginner stuff. Time for the good parts!
suggestLesson5.followUp: Lists are like... imagine your game inventory, or tracking all the enemies on screen. Essential stuff!

suggestLesson7.speaker: Pixel
suggestLesson7.text: Whoa, look at you! You're ready for the advanced stuff!
suggestLesson7.followUp: Dictionaries are like cheat sheets for your game - storing player stats, item properties, all that good data!

suggestLesson9.speaker: Pixel

assetSelected.speaker: Pixel
assetSelected.text: Nice pick! Okay, so we've got the basics... what feels most important to nail down next?

options.text: Let's figure out how to win!

gameType.platformer: In platformers, movement is everything! Let's set up jumping and running mechanics!
gameType.rpg: RPG controls are about exploration and interaction. Let's configure your character movement!
gameType.racing: Racing is all about speed and precision! Let's tune your vehicle controls!
gameType.default: Let's get your controls set up so you can interact with the game!

worldSetup.speaker: Pixel
worldSetup.text: Time to build your game world! This is where the magic happens!

gameType.platformer: Platformers need great level design with platforms, obstacles, and collectibles!
gameType.rpg: RPG worlds are vast and full of stories. Let's create your first area!

gameRules.text: Every game needs rules! How challenging do you want this to be?
